string-array.name: build_item_descriptions
string-array.item: Either a changelist number, or a label like "M4-rc20".
The name of the overall product.
The name of the industrial design.
The name of the underlying board, like "goldfish".
The name of the instruction set (CPU type + ABI convention) of native code.
The name of the second instruction set (CPU type + ABI convention) of native code.
The brand (e.g., carrier) the software is customized for, if any.
The end-user-visible name for the end product.
The type of build, like "user" or "eng".
Comma-separated tags describing the build, like "unsigned,debug".
A string that uniquely identifies this build. Do not attempt to parse this value.
This property only makes sense for internal engineering builds.
This property only makes sense for internal engineering builds.
This property only makes sense for internal engineering builds.
The name of the hardware (from the kernel command line or /proc).
The internal value used by the underlying source control to represent this build. E.g., a perforce changelist number or a git hash.
The user-visible version string. E.g., "1.0" or "3.4b5".
The user-visible SDK version of the framework. It is an integer starting at 1.
